page.title: 17Blaenpistyll field.
page.content: Blaenpistyll farm is about half a mile from our school.Ken Jones,his son Elwyn and his brother-in-law,Ben Davies run the dairy farm.They have fields on three sides of the school.At the end of April they started to prepare one of the fields for planting.They ploughed it,but in the first two weeks of April it rained and they were not able to finish preparing the field.In the middle of April,they Disk harrowed,used the Triple K cultivator,spike tooth harrowed,chain harrowed and spread nitrates,potash and phosphates on the field to feed the soil.Then they sowed grass and barley seed on April 24th.They rolled the field using three tractors,two David Browns and one Leyland.The tractors used 50 gallons of diesel.The barley is now 3 feet high and ready for cutting for silage.
